messages.content:
To take a backup of modified or customized alert definitions in the context provided, follow these steps:

1. Go to Admin > Config > Alerts > Manage Alert Definitions.
2. Select the folder which contains alert definitions that you want to backup and click Export Selected Definitions. To take a backup of all available alerts, select Alert definitions and then click Export All Definitions.

Note: Command details for exporting are not provided in the context.

messages.content:
Based on the provided context, here is a refined answer:

To take a backup of alert definitions which might have been modified or customized, follow these steps:

1. Go to Admin > Config > Alerts > Manage Alert Definitions.
2. Select the folder that contains alert definitions you want to backup and click Export Selected Definitions. Alternatively, select "Alert definitions" and click Export All Definitions to back up all available alerts.

Note: If the customization to alert definitions is done using only threshold values, then a backup of alert definitions is not required as these value changes are retained after upgrade (Section 3).

Steps:
1. Go to Admin > Config > Alerts > Manage Alert Definitions.
2. Select the folder which contains alert definitions that you want to backup and click Export Selected Definitions.
3. To export all available alerts, select "Alert definitions" and then click Export All Definitions.

Note: In versions earlier than SRM 4.3 (Section 6), also keep a copy of the alerting-contexts.xml from /opt/APG/ Backends/Alerting-Backend/conf directory.

messages.content:
To backup modified or customized alert definitions, follow these steps:

1. Go to Admin > Config > Alerts > Manage Alert Definitions.
2. Select the folder that contains the desired alert definitions and click Export Selected Definitions. To take a backup of all available alerts, select "Alert definitions" and then click Export All Definitions.

If you're using versions prior to SRM 4.3 (referenced in sections [1](#section1) and [5](#section5)), note that the information about copying alerting-contexts.xml is not relevant to the backup of alert definitions (see section [6](#section6)).


Note: This answer only includes information explicitly stated in the provided context.
